{{also|槟榔}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=槟榔|alt=賓桹,賓郎}}
{{wikipedia|lang=zh}}

===Etymology===
Described in ''{{w|Qimin Yaoshu}}'' {{defdate|544 {{CE}}}} and ''{{w|Taiping Yulan}}'' {{defdate|983 {{CE}}}}.

Borrowed from a Southern language, possibly a Mon-Khmer language. Compare {{cog|kxm||tr=naːt-phlɤːŋ||a kind of betel leaf bush}}, {{cog|thm||phalʌ̰̂ː|betel}}, {{cog|ms|pinang}}, as well as {{cog|mkh-pro|*mləw|*ml[əw]|betel}}, whence {{cog|km|ម្លូ}}, {{cog|vi|trầu}} (< {{cog|mkh-vie-pro|*b-luː}}), {{cog|th|พลู}} and perhaps Chinese {{och-l|扶留|a leaf chewed together with betel nut}}.

<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|ビンロウ|檳榔 (Areca palm)}}
{{wikipedia|Areca catechu}}
[[File:Palm_I_IMG_2108.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|檳榔}} (''binrō''): the '''''[[Areca catechu]]''''', the '''[[areca]]''' or '''[[betel palm]]'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|びん|ろう|yomi=on}}
From {{etyl|zh|ja|sort=びんろう}} {{m|zh|檳榔|tr=bīngláng}}, itself from {{etyl|ms|ja}} {{m|ms|pinang}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=on|びんろう|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|びんろう|ビンロウ|hhira=びんらう}}

# ''[[Areca catechu]]'', the [[areca]] or [[betel palm]]

=====Usage notes=====
As with many terms in biology, this term is often spelled in katakana.

=====Derived terms=====
